org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.store

Class AutomaticIndexStatisticsTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase
            • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.store.AutomaticIndexStatisticsTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Derby5582AutomaticIndexStatisticsTest

    public class AutomaticIndexStatisticsTest
extends BaseJDBCTestCase
    Tests various aspects of the automatic index statistics update feature, which is designed to run as a background task.

    Some of the tests ensure that the daemon is able to recover after encountering various kinds of "expected errors", for instance if the table is dropped while being scanned by the daemon.

      • createAndInsertSimple

        private void createAndInsertSimple(java.lang.String table,
                                   int rows)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Default method to create and populate a simple test table.

        The table consists of a two integer columns, where the first is the primary key of the table and the second is a value with a non-unique index on it.

        Parameters:
        table - target table
        rows - number of rows to insert
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if creating/populating the table fails

      • createAndInsertSimple

        private void createAndInsertSimple(java.sql.Connection con,
                                   java.lang.String table,
                                   int rows)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Default method to create and populate a simple test table.

        The table consists of a two integer columns, where the first is the primary key of the table and the second is a value with a non-unique index on it.

        Parameters:
        con - the connection to use (may be null, in which case the default connection will be used)
        table - target table
        rows - number of rows to insert
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if creating/populating the table fails

        Inserts the specified number of rows into the table, using an increasing integer as the value.

      • getFilteredTableStats

        private IndexStatsUtil.IdxStats[] getFilteredTableStats(java.lang.String table,
                                                        int expectedCount,
                                                        IndexStatsUtil.IdxStats[] oldStats)
                                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Obtains the statistics for all indexes associated with the given table in the default database.
        Parameters:
        table - base table
        expectedCount - number of statistics objects to obtain
        oldStats - statistics objects to ignore
        Returns:
        An array with the statistics objects obtained.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the number of statistics objects expected can't be obtained within the time limit (DEFAULT_TIMEOUT)
